cinnamon.engine.gfx

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.gfx.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObservableSize<Window>, Resizable, Size

    public final class Window
extends Object
implements Resizable, ObservableSize<Window>

    Represents an application window wrapping the GLFW windowing library.

    By default, a window opens using the minimum allowed dimension of MIN_WIDTH x MIN_HEIGHT, is decorated, not resizable, and with vsync enabled.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Window.Input
      Facilitates a connection to the Window's keyboard and mouse input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(Canvas canvas,
              String title)

        Constructs a Window with a given title and a specified drawing surface.

        This constructor should only be called on the main thread.

        Parameters:
        canvas - drawing operations.
        title - title bar text.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either canvas or title is null.
        IllegalStateException - if system resources failed to initialize a window.

    • Method Detail

      • addOnFramebufferResizeListener

        public void addOnFramebufferResizeListener(ObservableSize.OnResizeListener<Window> listener)

        Sets an OnResizeListener to be notified of changes to the Window's framebuffer size. These dimensions typically change when the Window's dimensions are changed.

        For dealing in screen coordinates such as MouseEvents, see ObservableSize.addOnResizeListener(OnResizeListener).

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - OnResizeListener.

      • addOnResizeListener

        public void addOnResizeListener(ObservableSize.OnResizeListener<Window> listener)

        Adds an OnResizeListener to be notified of changes to the Window's screen size. These dimensions are measured in screen coordinates. For dealing with pixel-based methods such as GL, see #addOnFramebufferResizeListener(OnResizeListener).

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

        Specified by:
        addOnResizeListener in interface ObservableSize<Window>
        Parameters:
        listener - OnResizeListener.

      • close

        public void close()

        Closes the window and signals the render thread to stop drawing operations. This method will block until the render thread ceases.

        This method should only be called from the main thread.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()

        Releases windowing resources and marks the window as no longer usable and cannot be reopened. If the window is open when this method is called, it is automatically closed.

      • getDepth

        public float getDepth()
        Description copied from interface: Size

        Gets the depth.

        Specified by:
        getDepth in interface Size
        Returns:
        depth.

      • getFramebufferHeight

        public int getFramebufferHeight()

        Gets the height of the Window's drawable area in pixels.

        On some systems, this method will return a value different than getHeight(). This method should be used when dealing specifically with pixels. For screen coordinates, see getHeight().

        This method can safely be called from any thread.

        Returns:
        height in pixels.

      • getFramebufferWidth

        public int getFramebufferWidth()

        Gets the width of the Window's drawable area in pixels.

        On some systems, this method will return a value different than getWidth(). This method should be used when dealing specifically with pixels. For screen coordinates, see getWidth().

        This method can safely be called from any thread.

        Returns:
        width in pixels.

        Returns:
        height.

        Returns:
        true if Vsync is enabled.

      • open

        public void open()

        Shows the Window and begins processing input Events.

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no Window.Input has yet been set.

      • pollEvents

        public void pollEvents()

        Processes windowing events and should be called continuously to trigger the window's callbacks and update its state. This method wraps GLFW.glfwPollEvents().

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y)

        Sets the Window's position on the primary display. The given (x,y) position will be clamped to keep the window within the primary display's boundaries.

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

        Parameters:
        x - x.
        y - y.

      • setPositionCenter

        public void setPositionCenter()

        Centers the window on the primary display.

        This method should only be called on the main thread.

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(boolean resizable)

        Sets whether the window can be resized by dragging the cursor along the boundary.

        Parameters:
        resizable - true to allow resizing by cursor.
